description: Mature evergreen and deciduous trees and shrubs. Colorful floral display in summer. Wrought iron fencing. Vegetables, herbs, and fruit trees. Originally on public land, this garden opened in 1981 with funding from Plant-A-Lot of the Council on the Environment of New York City (now GrowNYC). The property is now owned by the adjacent housing organization.
name: Kenton Hall Neighborhood Garden
